10 hours in it started crashing every time it saved. I reinstalled it, and it reverted to a save from 7 hours earlier. I'm not going to replay 7 hours to continue. That's really not acceptable. The game is fun, but every part outstays its welcome. It parodies lots of different games, each of which is fun for a while, but then it just keeps going for another 30-60 minutes. I get it, it's very clever, but I don't want to spend half an hour playing an endless runner. The part where you solve puzzles in the library was done very well in that regard. You only had to do 6, but got a reward if you finished all eight. More of that, where if it's your thing you can choose to do more, but if it's not you can move on with the game. I wish there were other examples, but that's the only one I can think of. Every other time, you just have to keep slogging through till they move on to the next game type. Also too much "go find all 5 keys from anywhere in the world before you can move on.". Ugh. People gave the game props for being a 20 hour experience, but too much of that is just very boring, tedious filler. For to much of the experience, I wasn't having fun, I was doing chores. (Literally at one point you have to earn money by doing chores.) In conclusion, the fun parts were fun, but there was way too much boring work in between. If it had been a more enjoyable experience I might be willing to replay the hours that got deleted. But the prospect of having to go through the tedium a second time to continue playing? No thanks, I'll just move on.

I like this game, but it has serious performance issues when you transition to 3-D graphics, apparently this an issue that plagues the pc version too. If you find yourself unable to play due to extreme lag when the 3-D portion comes up do your best to struggle through the roughly 10 minutes which should be probably 1 minute of cut scenes and move out to the world map and crawl your way to Bibi's. Once there the game will auto save. Quit to the main menu and in options change the 3-D graphics from maximum to average or low. Average will probably work until you get to the sidescrolling platformer and then there's more performance issues to where low graphics will be your only bet. It's because of this graphical performance weirdness I can't rate this 5 *'s, otherwise, I'd say it's worth the purchase as a decent follow up to the first one, although there's no turn based element so far if that's a deal breaker for you (doesn't bother me, the game play is more fluid than the first). Also, if you've got a Bluetooth controller, you're in luck, this is one of the few games that advertise Bluetooth compatability and means it.
